intro: Rhipidantha, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce showy, five-petaled flowers in a range of colors, including white, yellow, and red.
